name: Triangle Breathing
description: Three-phase breathing: inhale, hold, exhale (no bottom hold).
explanation: Simpler than box breathing, triangle breathing provides gentle nervous system regulation without the complexity of four phases.
when_to_use: Quick stress relief, focus enhancement, or as a beginner's alternative to box breathing.

round_messages.text: Three equal sides: inhale, hold, exhale. Simple and effective.
You're creating a steady, calming rhythm.

pre_session.text: This is a gentler version of box breathing.
Perfect for beginners or when you need something simple.

on_start.text: Follow the triangle: inhale, hold, exhale, then repeat.

on_end.text: Great work! Notice the sense of calm and focus.

cautions: Very gentle technique with minimal risk.
If holding feels uncomfortable, reduce the count to 3 seconds.
